summary: This bill, the Air Traffic Control Workforce Development Act of 2025, focuses on improving air traffic control training and addressing workforce issues within the FAA. It includes provisions for Collegiate Training Initiative program improvements, including grant programs and faculty enhancements. It mandates the formation of an aviation rulemaking committee to review and modernize curricula and the Air Traffic Skills Assessment (ATSA) exam. The bill also addresses facility equipment improvements, qualification incentives, retention bonuses, and mental health support for air traffic controllers, along with a report on the Airport Non-Cooperative Surveillance Radar program.
